definition: Johann Sebastian Bach (1685-1750), German composer
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail
surname He
awe-inspiring/abbr. for 赫茲|赫兹[he4 zi1], hertz (Hz)
Maybach, German car brand
Mönchengladbach (city in Germany)
pinyin: Men2 xing1 ge2 la1 de2 ba1 he4

definition: the Goldbach conjecture in number theory
pinyin: Ge1 de2 ba1 he4 cai1 xiang3

sentences.english: The Maybach has been adopted as the ultimate status symbol by Russia's super-rich.
sentences.chinese: 迈巴赫被视作俄国超级富豪的”终极身份象征“。

sentences.english: These developments culminated in the works of J. Bach and G. Handel .
sentences.chinese: 这一时期的种种进展在巴赫和亨德尔时达到了顶峰。

sentences.english: Sabah Family had ruled Kuwait for 284years.
sentences.chinese: 萨巴赫家族统治科威特至今已284个春秋。

sentences.english: He reiterated Kuwait's adherence to the One China policy.
sentences.chinese: 萨巴赫还重申了科政府坚持一个中国的政策。

sentences.english: Wolbachia's most common manipulation is to interfere in the success of the host's matings .
sentences.chinese: 沃巴赫菌最常用的手段是干扰宿主的交配结果。

sentences.english: Chapter two mainly presents Bakhtin's dialogic theory.
sentences.chinese: 第二章提出了巴赫金的对话理论。

sentences.english: Attach smaller ropes to big ropes with the Bachmann knot.
sentences.chinese: 小绳连接到大结绳与巴赫曼。

sentences.english: Mikhail Bakhtin's polyphonic novel is based on his dialogic theory.
sentences.chinese: 巴赫金的“复调小说”理论是以对话理论为基础的。

sentences.english: Bakhtin believes that dialogism is the foundation upon which a text is produced and its life sustained.
sentences.chinese: 巴赫金认为，对话性是文本产生和存在的基础。

sentences.english: Bach's cantata was written to be sung the third Sunday after Trinity.
sentences.chinese: 巴赫的康塔塔写的唱的第三个星期日后三一。

sentences.english: This paper gives a primary mathematical mathed to study Goldebach conjecture.
sentences.chinese: 文章给出一个研究哥德巴赫猜想的初等数学方法。

sentences.english: She will phrase a fugue of Bach's in these days.
sentences.chinese: 这几天她将把巴赫的赋格曲分成旋律分句。

sentences.english: Bach. One Prelude and Fugue from Well-tempered Clavier.
sentences.chinese: 巴赫，《十二平均律钢琴曲集》一个前奏和赋格曲。

sentences.english: I remember hearing Yo-Yo Ma play the Bach sonatas for cello and keyboard.
sentences.chinese: 我记得我听过马友友拉的巴赫大提琴与键盘奏鸣曲。

sentences.english: It is one of Bach's most tightly organized and yet viscerally effective prelude and fugue pairs.
sentences.chinese: 此曲是巴赫组织最为严密高效的前奏曲与赋格之一。

sentences.english: Orbach called on the Senate to reverse the House cuts.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴赫请求参议院推翻众议院的削减预算法案。

definition: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart (1756-1791), Austrian composer
Brahms (name)/Johannes Brahms (1833-1897), German romantic composer
Tchaikovsky (1840-1893), Russian composer
Ludwig van Beethoven (1770-1827), German composer
Frederic Chopin or Fryderyk Franciszek Chopin (1810-1849), Polish pianist and composer
Claude Debussy (1862-1918), French composer
Schumann (name)/Robert Schumann (1810-1856), romantic composer
Handel (name)/George Frideric Handel (1685-1759), German-born Baroque composer, naturalized British in 1727
Piotr Ilyich Tchaikowsky (1840-1893), Russian composer, composer of 6 symphonies and the opera Eugene Onegin
Strauss (name)/Johann Strauss (1825-1899), Austrian composer/Richard Strauss (1864-1949), German composer
Antonin Dvořák (1841-1904), Bohemian composer, author of nine symphonies including the New World symphony
Ferenc (Franz) Liszt (1811-1886), Hungarian composer/Joseph Lister (1883-1897), British surgeon and bacteriologist
Alexander Scriabin (1872-1915), Russian composer and pianist
Handel (name)/Georg Frideric Händel (1785-), German composer
Niccolò Paganini (1782-1840), Italian violinist and composer
Modest Mussorgsky (1839-1881), Russian composer, composer of Pictures at an Exhibition
